Updated November     pm









A customer at the OCC Swap Meet looks at a vendors plants and flowers for sale while finishing her ice cream cone on Sunday PERIOD

The Orange Coast College Swap Meet reopened on July  after over a yearlong closure due to COVID19 and vendors continue to attract large crowds to the Adams parking lot every weekend from  a.m PERIOD to  p.m. selling everything from handmade clothing and bracelets to fresh produce and plants PERIOD

While some sellers fill their spots with used items ready to be resold such as household appliances and old sneakers others fill tables and shelves with newly packaged goods such as keychains and earrings PERIOD

Attendees can venture up and down long aisles in the parking lot usually flooded with buyers snacking on tacos frozen yogurt and churros among various other foods made fresh to order sold at the meets entrance located near The Harbour PERIOD

The swap meet also features live music provided by a Mariachi band and a performance from Chinelos dancers on select weekends PERIOD The OCC Swap Meet Instagram posts the dates and times of when the groups will be making an appearance PERIOD

We have started to fill  of the spaces on Saturday and about  to  on Sundays said Ruben Barriga OCCs director of Community Services PERIOD Barrigo has been in charge of the meet since  PERIOD

Guadalupe a 13yearold girl originally from Mexico attends the swap meet as a seller every Saturday and Sunday PERIOD She assists her family in setting out a multitude of brand new accessories in differentiating styles along with other small items such as stuffed animals and lanyards PERIOD

Weve been doing this for about five years Guadalupe said PERIOD It helps us pay our monthly rent. a few pieces of jewelry Guadalupes family put on display at their spot to sell to swap meet attendees from Sunday PERIOD

Guadalupes family reserved a spot at the OCC Swap Meet on Sunday with cloth bracelets hung high to attract customers in the shade under solar panels PERIOD

Every weekend OCCs Adams parking lot is booming with sellers and consumers attending the event that has been ongoing for around  years PERIOD The amount of participants in the event has increased greatly since it first began PERIOD

It started only once a month then every Saturday  to  spaces max PERIOD When it became popular it had to be relocated to the Adams lot where now it houses more than  vendor spaces Barriga said PERIOD

Funds from the sold spots at the swap meet are directly distributed to various sectors of OCC PERIOD

Profits of these spots are used in many areas of the college swap meet personnel wages utilities campus safety and maintenance just to name a few Barriga said PERIOD

Parking and entrance are free of cost PERIOD Any cars parked inside the Harbour Student Housing lot will be cited PERIOD
